intro: Euonymus tibeticus, commonly known as the Tibetan spurge, is a shrub native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish flowers. The plant produces red-orange berries that are a distinctive feature, often attracting birds and other wildlife. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh, cold climate of its native habitat. Euonymus tibeticus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
